serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States Major Cities is a point theme representing locations for cities within United States with populations of 10,000 or greater (based on Census 2000 figures), all state capitals, and the national capital. Attribute information includes the name, class, state, capital status, land area, water area, population class and the 2000 population of the city as well as other demographic variable from the 2000 U.S. Census.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States Major Cities provides locations and attributes for cities.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:250,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.4.1420

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was calculated from latitude/longitude coordinates from the U.S. Census Bureau 2000 Summary File 1 (SF1). The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.title: Summary File 1 (SF1)
citeinfo.othercit: The Summary File 1 (SF1) data is based on the 2000 Census of Population. The geospatial data is calculated from the latitude/longitude coordinate attributes.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Created a data set by extracting state capitals, the national capital, and places of 10,000 or more inhabitants from U.S. Census Bureau 2000 Summary File 1 (SF1). Ran ArcView GIS command Add Event Theme on the data set to create the point location centroids shapefile. Reformatted attributes and finalized attribute order. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Simplified the AREANAME values for some of the features.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Renamed attributes AREANAME to NAME and POP_CL to POP_CLASS. Reduced the attribute width for NAME. Converted the values in the CLASS attribute to title case. Changed the CLASS attribute value "CDP" to "Census Designated Place". Changed the CAPITAL attribute values "Y" and "N" to "National", "State", or blank.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added the POP2007 attribute and populated it with values from ESRI Community Data. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent locations for cities within United States with populations of 10,000 or greater (based on Census 2000 figures), all state capitals, and the national capital.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
The city name.
The class of the city.

edom.edomvd: In Connecticut, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania, an incorporated place.

Census designated place - A statistical entity, defined for each decennial census according to Census Bureau guidelines, comprising a densely settled concentration of population that is not within an incorporated place, but is locally identified by a name.

An incorporated place in 49 States and the District of Columbia. In 20 States, some or all cities are not part of any minor civil division, and the Census Bureau also treats these as county subdivisions, statistically equivalent to minor civil divisions.
The portion of the consolidated city minus the incorporated places. For statistical purposes, these entities are treated as statistically equivalent to a place and have no legal basis or functions.
An incorporated place in 30 States. In New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and South Dakota, the Census Bureau treats these towns as the equivalent of a minor civil division.
An incorporated place in 20 States. The Census Bureau treats all villages in New Jersey, South Dakota, and Wisconsin, and some villages in Ohio as county subdivisions.

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the city is located.
